title: 2 Easy Ways to Send Voice Messages on an iPhone

steps.title: Tap a conversation in the Messages app.
steps.content: Tap a conversation in the Messages app. Doing so will open your conversation. If you can't find the conversation you need, swipe down on this screen and then type your contact's name into the Search bar at the top of the screen. You can tap the box with a pencil icon in the top right corner of the screen to create a new message. If you're already in a conversation with someone, you'll have to tap the Back button in the top left corner of the screen to view the "Messages" page.

steps.title: Tap the Audio Messages icon.
steps.content: Tap the Audio Messages icon. It's the blue icon with white soundwave lines just below the typing area. A red microphone icon will appear.

steps.title: Tap and hold the microphone as you speak.
steps.content: Tap and hold the microphone as you speak. Continue holding your finger to the icon until you're ready to send your message. As soon as you lift your finger from the screen, your audio message will be sent. This will only work when sending a message to another person who uses iMessage. You won't be able to send audio messages to Android users.

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Voice Memos app.
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Voice Memos app. Its app icon is black with a red soundwave and blue cursor. You'll find it on your Home screen or in your app library.

steps.title: Tap the red circular button.
steps.content: Tap the red circular button. It's at the bottom of the screen. Doing so will prompt your iPhone to start recording audio.

steps.title: Tap the red stop button when you're finished.
steps.content: Tap the red stop button when you're finished. Doing so will end the recording. You'll now see your most recent recording at the top of the "All Recordings" list.

steps.title: Tap the three horizontal dots on the recording.
steps.content: Tap the three horizontal dots on the recording. You'll see this icon to the right of the recording's name. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Tap Share.
steps.content: Tap Share . It's the second option on the menu. Your iPhone's sharing menu will appear.

steps.title: Tap Messages.
steps.content: Tap Messages . This option will open a new message template in the Messages app.

steps.title: Enter the recipient into the "To" field.
steps.content: Enter the recipient into the "To" field. You can start typing a contact's name, or tap + to select a contact from your Contacts list.

steps.title: Tap the Send icon.
steps.content: Tap the Send icon. This is the blue icon with a white arrow at the bottom-right corner of the message. Your voice memo will now be sent to the selected contact(s).
